prs.title: 🚀 Version packages
prs.truncated_body:
This PR was opened by the [Changesets release](https://github.com/changesets/action) GitHub action. When you're ready to do a release, you can merge this and the packages will be published to npm automatically. If you're not ready to do a release yet, that's fine, whenever you add more changesets to main, this PR will be updated.


# Releases
## @layerzerolabs/oft-solana-example@0.8.0

### Minor C

prs.title: chore: normalize oft send task
prs.truncated_body:
### In this PR:

This PR refactors and unifies our cross-chain “send OFT” task so that both EVM and Solana versions share the same entrypoint, configuration, and output formatting. Rather than maintaining two separate Hardhat tasks, we now have a single `lz:oft:send` task that:

1. Parses a common set of parameters (`srcEid`, `dstEid`, `amount`, `to`, plus optional overrides).
2. Dispatches t

commits.message: chore: move parseDecimals function to utils
chore: normalize info and add optionalParams for composer, extraOptions
fix: replace incorrect isTestnet logic for generic logic
chore: add better logging for quote and send errors
chore: add logging for hre errors
fix: make sure composeMsg is undefined

prs.title: Feat: add script to deploy a new `VestedRewardsDistribution` contract for the USDS -> SKY farm
prs.truncated_body:
The new script will be used to deploy a new `VestedRewardsDistribution` contract on Mainnet.

It is required because we are switching from `MCD_VEST_SKY` – which mints SKY tokens for vesting streams – to `MCD_VEST_SKY_TREASURY` – which uses SKY tokens held in the Sky Protocol's Treasury instead.

The `vest` parameter from `VestedRewardsDistribution` is `immutable`, so a new deplo

commits.message: feat: add script to deploy a new rewards distribution contract
fix: broken test after forge-std update

prs.title: ci:  Use `release.anza.xyz` instead of `release.solana.com` to install Solana CLI
prs.truncated_body:
Solana CI jobs using `release.solana.com` to install Solana CLI seem to fail with `solana-keygen: command not found` error as `https://release.solana.com` is not accessible. This PR:
* Updates CI to use the new domain `https://release.anza.xyz` instead
* Creates new GitHub action `setup-anchor` that is adapted from the `metadaoproject/setup-anchor@v2` action but uses the new domain instead

commits.message: Try using `release.anza.xyz` instead of `release.solana.com` to install solana CLI
Move inputs to be in scope of `anchor-test` job
nit: Keep spacing consistent between steps
Move `Setup Anchor` into its own action
testnet_consts.go: removed deprecated bArtio SR entry

prs.title: Mezo mainnet deployment
prs.truncated_body:
Adds support for Mezo on mainnet and provides .env.mezo.mainnet used for deploying WH Core and Token Bridge contracts to Mezo Mainnet

- Core contract [here](https://explorer.mezo.org/address/0xaBf89de706B583424328B54dD05a8fC986750Da8)
- Token bridge contract [here](https://explorer.mezo.org/address/0xF97B81E513f53c7a6B57Bd0b103a6c295b3096C5)

To enable Mezo on mainnet, use the following conf

commits.message:
Mezo mainnet deployment

- Provides .env.mezo.mainnet used for deploying WH Core and Token Bridge
  contracts to Mezo Mainnet

Add Mezo mainnet values to node and SDK

Adds support for Mezo on mainnet.

    Core contract here
    Token bridge contract here

To enable Mezo on mainnet, use the following config parameters:

```
--mezoRPC YOUR_MEZO_RPC
--mezoContract 0xaBf89de706B583424328B54dD05a8fC986750Da8
```

Verification
~~~
|- go run verify.go --chainId 50
Verifying prod mezo...
   Verifying EVM chain ID for prod mezo ✓
   Verifying finality values for prod mezo ✓
   Verifying contract address for prod mezo ✓
Verifying test mezo...
   Verifying EVM chain ID for test mezo ✓
   Verifying finality values for test mezo ✓
   Verifying contract address for test mezo ✓
~~~

Update mainnet_tokens_test.go

SeiEVM -> Mezo in comment

prs.title: chore: removes remaining usages of legacy proposal
prs.truncated_body: This PR removes legacy references to the `ccip-owner-contracts` proposal and timelock code in favor of using the new MCMS-based implementations. It deletes deprecated code, cleans up imports, and updates test helpers and assertions to use MCMS timelock proposal structures and utilities. Additionally, it adds a linter rule to enforce the use of MCMS instead of the `ccip-owner-contracts` proposal pa

This commit removes the remaining usages of the legacy MCMS proposals.

prs.title: simplify handling of block hash mismatch case
prs.truncated_body:
This is a simplification, where if we detect a block hash divergence we log out all of the information we have (which will be at least a block header, possibly a block header with additional hydrated transactions). 

This removes the need to do type checking on generic types and to pull out the state root for special treatment, etc.

commits.message:
simplify handling of block hash mismatch case

log out all of the information we have
tweak godoc to remove reference to state root

prs.title: Concurrency in processBlocksSequentially
prs.truncated_body:
Issue #162

The purpose of this PR is to remove tight coupling between fetching events and processing them. 
Once they are independent (i.e. run concurrently) we will be able to change parallelism of events processing.

One thing to keep in mind that old log message might not be true anymore.
For example "Processed blocks up to height %d" means that this block was actually fetched, but it's

commits.message: Add concurrency in processBlocksSequentially. Processing of events is indepedant from events fetching

prs.title: fix(rollup verifier): nil pointer due to missing `CommittedBatchMeta`
prs.truncated_body:
## 1. Purpose or design rationale of this PR
fix nil pointer due to `CommittedBatchMeta` not being found in the DB and add rewind of L1 sync height to recover from missing `CommittedBatchMeta`. This is most likely caused by a faulty L1 RPC (missing or out-of-order events). With this mechanism rollup verifier should be able to handle and recover from such a case. 

This should also fix: https://

commits.message: fix nil pointer due to CommittedBatchMeta not being found in the DB and add rewind of L1 sync height to recover from missing CommittedBatchMeta

prs.title: refactor(core): apply zod validation
prs.truncated_body:
This pull request introduces schema validation using `zod` for API responses and updates the dependency versions accordingly. The key changes include replacing manual type checks with `zod` schemas, adding reusable schema definitions for `Hex` and `Address`, and updating the `zod` dependency to version `3.25.7`.

### Schema Validation Improvements
* Introduced `zod` schemas for API response val

refactor(api): remove strict validation from response schemas
fix(api): add fallback error handling in assertAcceptedResult function

refactor(api): reorganize imports and improve formatting in various files
refactor(api): simplify response validation by introducing helper functions

prs.title: Unmap MAP_SHARED stacks on fork()
prs.truncated_body:
Firedancer threads don't support fork(). If a user calls fork() regardless, wild memory corruption ensues, crashing both parent and child. This PR keeps the parent alive and crashes the child reliably.

- [x] Test `fddev --no-sandbox`

prs.title: Call antehandlers for traceBlock
prs.truncated_body:
## Describe your changes and provide context
There were two issues with how antehandlers are invoked during tracing:
1. antehandlers are not invoked for `debug_traceBlock...` endpoints, which would specifically cause absence of address association
2. antehandlers should not charge gas fees as the tracer call would handle that

## Testing performed to validate your change
patched on archive n

prs.title: fix(test): Fix Deposit Contract Predeploy Code
prs.truncated_body:
The Deposit Contract Predeploy Code in several tests is different to that of testnet and mainnet. 

This issue was discovered as I surprised to find I could deposit 1 BERA minimum, when the minimum should have been 10_000 BERA.

prs.title: fix: remove profile: minimal from workflow files and add components where needed
prs.truncated_body:
# Fix CI issues by removing `profile: minimal` from workflow files

## Description
This PR fixes the flaky CI issues by removing the `profile: minimal` parameter from all GitHub workflow files. As mentioned in the Slack thread, this parameter was causing toolchain components to not be installed properly, leading to failures in CI but not in PR builds.

## Changes
- Removed `profile: minimal` from

commits.message:
fix: remove profile: minimal from workflow files and add components where needed

Co-Authored-By: Jayant Krishnamurthy <jayant@dourolabs.xyz>

# Extract RETRY_PREVIOUS_BLOCKS into EthereumConfig

## Description
This PR extracts the hardcoded `RETRY_PREVIOUS_BLOCKS` constant from `block.rs` into a configurable field in the `EthereumConfig` struct. The default value in the config is set to the current hardcoded value (100).

## Changes
- Added a new field `retry_previous_blocks` to `EthereumConfig` struct in `config.rs`
- Created a default

prs.title: feat(fortuna): better logging + avoid unnecessary fee syncs
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

- Add a new config that disables fee syncs if the chain is already registered.
- Improve logging:
  - Change retry log levels from ERROR to WARN
  - Add more info on some other logs

## Rationale

Whenever we deploy a new version or change some configuration, the setup script is executed and fees are synced to the default value. This is unnecessary and can cause problems for s

commits.message: feat(fortuna): better logging + avoid unnecessary fee syncs

prs.truncated_body:
### What
Bump version to 23.0.0-rc.1.1, creating release branch.

### Why
Triggered by @dmkozh in https://github.com/stellar/rs-soroban-sdk/actions/runs/15173562109.

### What is next

See the release instructions for a full rundown on the release process:
https://github.com/stellar/actions/blob/main/README-rust-release.md

Commit any changes to the `release/v23.0.0-rc.1.1` branch that are needed

prs.title: Muxed address support for Soroban SDK.
prs.truncated_body:
### What

This introduces the `MuxedAddress` type that maps to either `AddressObject` or `MuxedAddressObject`. This also adds a new helper for building token events with muxed addresses as per CAP-67.

### Why

Support for CAP-67.

### Known limitations

N/A

commits.message:
Muxed address support for Soroban SDK.

This introduces the `MuxedAddress` type that maps to either `AddressObject` or `MuxedAddressObject`.

prs.title: Improve the check for the events invariant.
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

Improve the check for the events invariant.

Events are not generated when meta is disabled (because there wouldn't be a way to consume them), thus the invariant check should also ensure that meta is present.

# Checklist
- [ ] Reviewed the [contributing](https://github.com/stellar/stellar-core/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-changes) document
- [ ] Rebased on top of

commits.message:
Improve the check for the events invariant.

Events are not generated when meta is disabled (because there wouldn't be a way to consume them), thus the invariant check should also ensure that meta is present.

prs.title: Fix: Era Info voting stake discrepancy when performing unstake/move operations
prs.truncated_body:
**Pull Request Summary**

This PR fixes a bug that caused discrepancies in the voting stake in `EraInfo`, particularly during unstake or move operations.

### Context

Previously, the `EraInfo::unstake_amount` method incorrectly aggregated the unstaked **voting** and **build_and_earn** stakes using the `total` method, and subtracted the combined amount starting with **build_and_earn**. While

## Description

This PR adds support for handling long-pending transactions. It addresses the issue of transactions that remain in a pending state for extended periods without being confirmed in the mempool, which can lead to system bloat.

## Changes

- Added long-pending transaction detection and processing to the DepositProcessor service:
- Implemented process_long_pending method to iden

prs.title: Batch insert observed messages using Duckdb appender
prs.truncated_body:
For fast batch insertion of messages observed into duckdb, use the native appender to batch the messages based on size or max wait time. Whichever happens first.

Fixes #993

commits.message:
Batch insert observed messages using Duckdb appender

For fast batch insertion of messages observed into duckdb, use the
native appender to batch the messages based on size or max wait time.
Whichever happens first.

Fixes #993

Periodically attempt to flush in-flight messages out to the database

This is to ensure max batch delay is respected independent of message
arrival/discovery flow.
Fix usage of timer instead of ticker for both rotation and flush

## PR Chain: tmpnet+kube

commits.message:
[tmpnet] Replace TestEnvironment.URIs with GetLocalNodeURIs()

Previously it was possible to use TestEnvironment.URIs to access node
API endpoints. If a node is running in a kube cluster, however, it
won't be accessible from outside that cluster. Adding
TestEnvironment.GetLocalNodeURIs and updating callers to use that
ensures URIs that will work regardless of the location of nodes and
test workloads.
fixup: Add check for available nodes
fixup: Indicate the purpose of cleanup in docstrings

prs.title: feat: Support nonzero shard/realm in fee and schedule commands
prs.truncated_body:
This PR adds support for nonzero shard/realm in the `fee` and `schedule` commands. 

The biggest set of changes is in `CostOfEveryThingSuite`, but the changes aren't as large as they appear. There are only two conceptual differences: first, replacing the `.given()/.when()/.then()` paradigm; second, returning a `HapiTest` object instead of `Stream<DynamicTest>` from each of the 'subspec' methods

commits.message:
Support nonzero shard/realm in fee commands, schedule commands

Fixes #10992 

**Notes for reviewer**:

Though we limit the number of jest workers to 2 for CI and 50% of the CPU cores in other envs, it doesn't really limit the number of database containers we create. The reason is jest

prs.title: Split downloaded files by date into different folders
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:

The mirror node is already able to read and parse files organized by folders representing days, but the organization of the files in such a way is up to the operators.

Example of already supported file organization

```shell
./data/streams/2025-04-21/recordstreams/record0.0.4/2025-04-21T23_22_12.797932000Z.rcd.gz 
./data/streams/2025-04-21/recordstreams/record0.0.4/sidec

commits.message:
Split downloaded files by date

Signed-off-by: Giuseppe Bertone <giuseppe.bertone@proton.me>

chore: Update MAINTAINERS

Signed-off-by: Jessica Wagantall <jwagantall@linuxfoundation.org>

Signed-off-by: Jessica G <jwagantall@linuxfoundation.org>

# Description

When the `MemorySnapshot` is committed, the batch is not cleaned, it must be cleaned or otherwise can produce undesired results.
